Package imagingbook.common.util

Interface ParameterBundle

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BernsenThresholder.Parameters, BilateralF.Parameters, CannyEdgeDetector.Parameters, DiZenzoCumaniEdgeDetector.Parameters, EllipseGeometricFitCoord.Parameters, EllipseGeometricFitDist.Parameters, GenericRansacDetector.RansacParameters, GradientCornerDetector.Parameters, GrayscaleEdgeDetector.Parameters, HoughTransformLines.Parameters, InterpolatingThresholder.Parameters, KuwaharaF.Parameters, LucasKanadeMatcher.Parameters, MonochromaticEdgeDetector.Parameters, MserDetector.Parameters, NagaoMatsuyamaF.Parameters, NiblackThresholder.Parameters, PeronaMalikF.Parameters, RansacDetectorCircle.Parameters, RansacDetectorEllipse.Parameters, RansacDetectorLine.Parameters, SauvolaThresholder.Parameters, SiftDetector.Parameters, SiftMatcher.Parameters, TschumperleDericheF.Parameters
    public interface ParameterBundle
    Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes. This is part of the 'simple parameter object' scheme, working with public fields. Only non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters. Current features: (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields. (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's GenericDialog, supported by specific annotations. Use methods addToDialog(GenericDialog) and getFromDialog(GenericDialog). See the example in DemoParameters below. Other functionality may be added in the future. 
     // Example parameter bundle:
 
 enum MyEnum { A, B, Cee };
 
 static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
        public static int staticInt = 44; // currently static members are listed too!
 
        @DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
        public boolean someBool = true;
        public int someInt = 39;
        public float someFloat = 1.99f;
 
        @DialogLabel("Math.PI")
        @DialogDigits(10)
        public double someDouble = Math.PI;
        public String someString = "SHOW ME";
 
        @DialogHide
        public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
        public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
 }
 
 public static void main(String[] args) {
        ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
        System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
 
        GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
        gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
        params.addToDialog(gd);
 
        gd.showDialog();
        if (gd.wasCanceled())
                return;
 
        int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
        boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
        System.out.println("success = " + success);
        System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
 }
    Version:
    2022/02/02
    See Also:
    ParameterBundle.DialogDigits, ParameterBundle.DialogLabel, ParameterBundle.DialogHide

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  ParameterBundle.DialogDigits
      Annotation to specify the number of digits displayed when showing numeric values in dialogs.
      static interface  ParameterBundle.DialogHide
      Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
      static interface  ParameterBundle.DialogLabel
      Annotation to specify a specific 'label' to be shown for following parameter fields.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default void addFieldToDialog​(Field field, ij.gui.GenericDialog dialog)
      Adds the specified Field of this object as new item to the GenericDialog instance.
      default void addToDialog​(ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)
      Adds all qualified fields of this parameter bundle to the specified GenericDialog instance, in the order of their definition.
      default boolean getFieldFromDialog​(Field field, ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)
      Modifies the specified Field of this object by reading the next item from the GenericDialog instance.
      default boolean getFromDialog​(ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)

    • Method Detail

      • printToString

        default String printToString()

      • printToStream

        default void printToStream​(PrintStream strm)

      • validate

        default boolean validate()
        Validates the correctness and compatibility of the parameters in this bundle. Implementing classes should override this method.
        Returns:
        true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise

      • addToDialog

        default void addToDialog​(ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)
        Adds all qualified fields of this parameter bundle to the specified GenericDialog instance, in the order of their definition. Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no ParameterBundle.DialogHide annotation is present.
        Parameters:
        gd - a generic dialog

      • getFromDialog

        default boolean getFromDialog​(ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)

      • isValidParameterItem

        static boolean isValidParameterItem​(Field f)

      • printModifiers

        static void printModifiers​(Field f)

      • addFieldToDialog

        default void addFieldToDialog​(Field field,
                              ij.gui.GenericDialog dialog)
                       throws IllegalAccessException
        Adds the specified Field of this object as new item to the GenericDialog instance. The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item. TODO: this method should be private (possible in Java9)!
        Parameters:
        field - some field
        dialog - the dialog
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - when field is accessed illegally

      • getFieldFromDialog

        default boolean getFieldFromDialog​(Field field,
                                   ij.gui.GenericDialog gd)
                            throws IllegalAccessException
        Modifies the specified Field of this object by reading the next item from the GenericDialog instance. TODO: this method should be private (possible in Java9)!
        Parameters:
        field - a publicly accessible Field of this object
        gd - a GenericDialog instance
        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - illegal field access
